documentation.title: Array Indentation
documentation.standard: The array closing bracket indentation should line up with the start of the content on the line containing the array opener.

code.title: Valid: Closing bracket lined up correctly
Invalid: Closing bracket lined up incorrectly

documentation.standard: In multi-line arrays, array items should be indented by a 4-space tab for each level of nested array, so that the array visually matches its structure.

code.title: Invalid: Indented incorrectly; harder to read.

documentation.standard: Multiline array items should indent at least as much as the first line of the array item.

code.title: Valid: Subsequent lines are indented correctly.
Invalid: Subsequent items are indented to the same level as the key.

documentation.standard: With heredoc and nowdoc, all text inside the opening and closing tag is ignored. The opening tag and comma after the closing tag should be indented according to normal multi-line array indentation.

code.title: Valid: Opening tag and comma after closing tag are indented correctly

code_comparison.code: $text = array( <<<EOD start of phrase concatented additional phrase more text EOD , );

code.title: Invalid: Opening tag is aligned incorrectly to match the closing tag. The comma does not align correctly with the array indentation.

code_comparison.code: $text = array( << start of phrase concatented additional phrase more text EOD , );
